title: About This Project

Vidhi A. Sharma

As students applying for internships, we wanted to uncover why job applications often feel like sending messages into the void.

title: About This Project
text: As students applying for internships, we wanted to uncover why job applications often feel like sending messages into the void.

title: Findings ‚Äì AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth
text:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping industries, leading to both job displacement and job creation. According to the World Economic Forum (2024), AI will impact 85 million jobs but simultaneously create 97 million new ones (Forum (2024)).





Code
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

# Industry-wise job impact data
data = {
    "Industry": ["Tech & Data Science", "Finance", "Manufacturing", "Retail & Customer Service", "Healthcare", "Marketing & Advertising"],
    "Jobs Created": [500000, 300000, 250000, 200000, 400000, 150000],
    "Jobs Lost": [50000, 150000, 300000, 500000, 50000, 80000]
}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Create interactive bar chart
fig = px.bar(df, x="Industry", y=["Jobs Created", "Jobs Lost"], 
             title="AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth vs. Loss by Industry",
             barmode="group", labels={"value": "Number of Jobs", "variable": "Job Impact"})

fig.show()


        
        
        


                            
                                            


‚úÖ Finding: AI is not just eliminating jobs‚Äîit is reshaping job roles and requiring new skill sets (Online (2024)).

title: Key Findings on Job Market Trends
text:
Internal Changes: Hiring priorities, budgets, or restructuring shifts.
Process Inefficiencies: Recruiters are overwhelmed with too many applications.
Ghost Jobs: Fake job postings to appear expanding or build a candidate pool.

title: Key Findings on Job Market Trends
text:
AI is displacing jobs in clerical work, finance, and IT.
Jobs Most at Risk: Data entry, accounting, investment analysis.
New AI Jobs: AI Ethics Specialists, AI Trainers, Data Scientists.

title: Key Findings on Job Market Trends
text: AI-related jobs are earning 77.53% more than traditional occupations.

title: AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
2.1 üìâ Jobs AI Is Replacing
AI-driven automation is rapidly eliminating traditional jobs across industries:
üìå Clerical & Admin Work ‚Üí Data Entry Clerks, Secretaries
üìå Retail & Banking ‚Üí Cashiers, Bank Tellers
üìå Customer Service ‚Üí AI Chatbots replacing human agents
üìå Manufacturing ‚Üí Automated assembly lines replacing factory workers

‚ÄúMachines don‚Äôt call in sick, but they also don‚Äôt innovate.‚Äù ‚Äì Industry Expert

title: AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
2.2 üìà AI-Powered Job Growth
Despite job losses, AI is creating new career opportunities:
‚úî Data Science & AI Engineering ‚Üí 400% increase in job postings
‚úî Cybersecurity Analysts ‚Üí High demand due to AI-driven fraud risks
‚úî AI Ethics & Compliance Experts ‚Üí Regulatory demand is booming
‚úî Healthcare AI Specialists ‚Üí AI-assisted diagnostics & robotics surgery
üí° Industries experiencing AI-powered growth:
Tech, Finance, Healthcare, E-Commerce, Cybersecurity

To beat AI-powered hiring systems, job seekers must:

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text: title: ‚ÄúJob Market Findings: AI, Ghosting, & Salary Drama‚Äù format: html toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
text:
2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
Ghosting is no longer just for dating. A 2024 survey found that 52% of job seekers never heard back after multiple interview rounds (Herschberg, 2024).

2.1.1 Why Do Companies Ghost?

Internal Chaos: Budget cuts, layoffs, or leadership playing ‚Äúmusical chairs.‚Äù
Recruiter Burnout: Some recruiters manage hundreds of applicants per job (so yes, your ‚Äújust checking in‚Äù email is lost in the abyss).
Fake Jobs? Yep. Some listings are just for show‚Äîused to collect resumes or gauge market interest (Herschberg, 2024).



2.1.2 How to Beat the Ghosting Game

Always ask for a hiring timeline. If they don‚Äôt give one, it‚Äôs a red flag.
Follow up‚Äîbut no begging. Twice is enough. After that, move on.
Network like your career depends on it (because it does). Referrals triple your chances of getting hired (Greenhouse, 2024).

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
text:
2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
AI isn‚Äôt just replacing workers‚Äîit‚Äôs reshaping entire industries. The World Economic Forum predicts 85 million jobs will disappear by 2025, but 97 million new ones will emerge (WEF, 2023). So, it‚Äôs like musical chairs‚Ä¶ but with robots.

2.2.1 Jobs Most at Risk:

Clerical/Admin: If your job involves copy-pasting all day, AI has bad news for you.
Customer Support: Chatbots are stealing jobs faster than customers can say, ‚ÄúI want to speak to a manager!‚Äù
Manufacturing & Retail: Self-checkouts don‚Äôt call in sick.



2.2.2 Jobs AI is Creating

AI Ethics Consultants: Someone has to stop AI from ruining everything.
Data Analysts & Scientists: AI needs humans to fix its mistakes.
Cybersecurity Experts: AI is smart, but hackers are smarter.

title: Career Strategy for AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Seekers
text:
The rapid rise of AI-powered careers has left many job seekers wondering: ‚ÄúShould I pivot towards AI, or are traditional careers still viable?‚Äù
This section provides a data-driven roadmap for career success in 2024, including in-demand skills, high-paying roles, and resume optimization strategies.

title: Career Strategy for AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Seekers

title: Career Strategy for AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Seekers
text:
4 3Ô∏è‚É£ Career Strategy Recommendations
Here are six practical career strategies for adapting to AI-driven job market changes:

Invest in AI & Data Science Skills üìä

Learn Python, Machine Learning, and AI-driven analytics.

Take courses in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Big Data.

Target High-Growth AI Industries üöÄ

Prioritize careers in finance, tech, and healthcare, where AI adoption is rising.

Embrace AI-Powered Work Environments üí°

Stay ahead by using automation tools and AI-powered platforms in daily tasks.

Develop Soft Skills for AI Collaboration ü§ù

Strengthen critical thinking, creativity, and emotional intelligence to work effectively alongside AI.

Build interdisciplinary skills (e.g., combining AI with marketing, finance, or healthcare).

Build an AI-Enhanced Personal Brand üåê

Use LinkedIn, GitHub, and personal blogs to showcase AI-related projects.

Publish AI-driven case studies or portfolio projects to attract employers.

Stay Updated with Emerging AI Trends üì¢

Follow AI industry leaders, attend conferences, and take part in AI hackathons.

Subscribe to AI-focused publications like MIT Technology Review, Google AI Blog, and OpenAI research.

title: Career Strategy for AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Seekers
text:
5 4Ô∏è‚É£ Personal Career Plan
Each job seeker should create a customized roadmap based on their career goals. This includes:

Skill Development: Identify technical and soft skills required for your desired role.

Industry Research: Follow hiring trends in AI and traditional careers.

Resume Optimization: Tailor your resume with AI-related skills and projects.

Adapt to Hybrid Work Environments

Develop proficiency in remote collaboration tools (Slack, Zoom, etc.).
Balance AI-assisted productivity with human-centered problem-solving.

Optimize Resumes for ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems)

Utilize AI-friendly resume formats to enhance visibility.

Strengthen Human Skills

Focus on problem-solving, emotional intelligence, and creative thinking.
Build leadership and adaptability to work alongside AI systems.

title: AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Growth: Is AI Taking Over or Creating More Jobs?
text:
The debate on whether AI is eliminating jobs or creating new ones has become a critical discussion point in 2024. As automation and machine learning continue to reshape industries, workers are facing both risks and opportunities.
This study examines the job displacement risks due to AI, the growth of AI-powered job roles, and how industries are adapting to this technological shift. Our findings are based on real-world employment trends, salary data, and AI integration across sectors.

title: Findings ‚Äì AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth
text:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping industries, leading to both job displacement and job creation. According to the World Economic Forum (2024), AI will impact 85 million jobs but simultaneously create 97 million new ones (Forum (2024)).





Code
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

# Industry-wise job impact data
data = {
    "Industry": ["Tech & Data Science", "Finance", "Manufacturing", "Retail & Customer Service", "Healthcare", "Marketing & Advertising"],
    "Jobs Created": [500000, 300000, 250000, 200000, 400000, 150000],
    "Jobs Lost": [50000, 150000, 300000, 500000, 50000, 80000]
}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Create interactive bar chart
fig = px.bar(df, x="Industry", y=["Jobs Created", "Jobs Lost"], 
             title="AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth vs. Loss by Industry",
             barmode="group", labels={"value": "Number of Jobs", "variable": "Job Impact"})

fig.show()


        
        
        


                            
                                            


‚úÖ Finding: AI is not just eliminating jobs‚Äîit is reshaping job roles and requiring new skill sets (Online (2024)).

title: Findings ‚Äì AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth
text:
2 2Ô∏è‚É£ AI vs.¬†Non-AI Career Salary Trends
As AI becomes more integrated into industries, AI-powered careers offer significantly higher salaries than traditional jobs (BizReport (2024)). Below is a comparison of AI vs.¬†Non-AI salaries in 2024.

2.1 üìà Interactive Table: AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Salaries


Code
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import pandas as pd

# Salary comparison data
df_salary = pd.DataFrame({
    "Job Role": ["Machine Learning Engineer", "Data Scientist", "AI Risk Analyst (Finance)", "Software Developer", "Mechanical Engineer", "Customer Service Rep"],
    "AI-Powered Career?": ["‚úÖ Yes", "‚úÖ Yes", "‚úÖ Yes", "‚ùå No", "‚ùå No", "‚ùå No"],
    "Average Salary (2024)": ["$140,000", "$125,000", "$118,000", "$95,000", "$85,000", "$45,000"]
})

fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Table(
    header=dict(values=list(df_salary.columns),
                fill_color='paleturquoise',
                align='left'),
    cells=dict(values=[df_salary[col] for col in df_salary.columns],
               fill_color='lavender',
               align='left'))
])

fig.show()


                            
                                            


‚úÖ Finding: AI-powered careers command higher salaries than traditional roles, making AI skills essential for career advancement (Forbes (2024)).

title: Findings ‚Äì AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth
section: 3 3Ô∏è‚É£ AI Job Automation Risks: Who Is at Risk?
text:
3 3Ô∏è‚É£ AI Job Automation Risks: Who Is at Risk?
AI is automating repetitive tasks across industries, putting millions of jobs at risk. Research from ScienceDirect (2024) shows that AI will impact several sectors over the next five years (ScienceDirect (2024)).







At-Risk Job Categories
Examples of Jobs AI is Replacing




Clerical Work
Data entry clerks, secretaries


Retail & Banking
Cashiers, bank tellers, call center agents


Manufacturing & Logistics
Assembly line workers, warehouse packers



‚úÖ Finding: The job displacement risk is highest for repetitive, rule-based tasks‚Äîbut AI-driven reskilling can mitigate this risk (Massachusetts (2024)).

title: AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Growth: Is AI Taking Over or Creating More Jobs?
section: 0.5 4Ô∏è‚É£ The Rise of New AI-Powered Job Titles
text:
0.5 4Ô∏è‚É£ The Rise of New AI-Powered Job Titles
Despite concerns about automation, entirely new job categories are emerging in AI-dominated industries.







New AI-Driven Roles
Description




Prompt Engineers
Specialize in fine-tuning AI-generated content.


AI Ethics Officers
Ensure AI is used responsibly.


AI-Powered Marketing Analysts
Leverage AI to optimize digital campaigns.


Automation Engineers
Design AI-driven automation for businesses.



‚úÖ Finding: AI is not just destroying jobs‚Äîit is actively creating new ones that never existed before.

Not all industries are affected by AI at the same rate. Here‚Äôs an interactive visualization showing AI-driven job creation vs.¬†displacement.
import pandas as pd import plotly.express as px

title: AI vs.¬†Non-AI Job Growth: Is AI Taking Over or Creating More Jobs?
text:
2.1 5Ô∏è‚É£ Key Takeaways & Career Recommendations

2.1.1 5.1 Summary of Findings
üìå AI is not purely replacing jobs‚Äîit is reshaping them.
üìå AI-powered roles command higher salaries than traditional roles.
üìå Some jobs face displacement, but new AI careers are emerging.


2.1.2 5.2 What Should Job Seekers Do?

Invest in AI-related skills: Learning machine learning, Python, and AI-driven analytics will increase job security.
Target high-growth AI industries: Finance, healthcare, and tech are leading in AI adoption.
Adapt to AI-powered work environments: Understanding AI tools will help traditional job roles remain relevant.

title: Findings ‚Äì AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth
text:
